SEARCH
Package grafiosch.repository

Class RepositoryHelper

java.lang.Object
grafiosch.repository.RepositoryHelper
public class RepositoryHelper extends Object
Utility class providing helper methods for JPA repository operations.

This class contains static methods that provide common functionality for repository operations, particularly focused on selective entity updates based on annotation-driven property filtering. It helps reduce boilerplate code in repository implementations and ensures consistent update behavior across the application.

  • Method Details

    • saveOnlyAttributes

      @Transactional @Modifying public static <T extends BaseID<Integer>> T saveOnlyAttributes(org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<T,Integer> jpaRepository, T entity, T existingEntity, Set<Class<? extends Annotation>> updatePropertyLevelClasses) throws Exception
      Saves an entity with selective attribute updates based on annotation filtering.

      This method provides a flexible approach to entity updates by allowing selective copying of attributes from the input entity to an existing entity based on annotation classes. This is particularly useful for scenarios where only certain fields should be updated (e.g., during imports, partial updates, or when specific update rules apply).

      The method handles both create and update scenarios:

      • If existingEntity is null, saves the new entity directly
      • If existingEntity exists, copies allowed attributes from entity to existingEntity and saves the updated version

      Attribute copying is controlled by the updatePropertyLevelClasses parameter, which specifies which annotation classes mark fields as updatable. Only fields annotated with these annotation types will be copied from the source entity to the existing entity.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the entity type extending BaseID with Integer primary key
      Parameters:
      jpaRepository - the JPA repository for the entity type
      entity - the source entity containing new values to be saved or merged
      existingEntity - the existing entity to update, or null for new entity creation
      updatePropertyLevelClasses - set of annotation classes that mark fields as updatable
      Returns:
      the saved entity (either the new entity or the updated existing entity)
      Throws:
      Exception - if the update process fails, including reflection errors during attribute copying
